activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Allen Siewert

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 8, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

10:28 AM Defendant Ronald Allen Siewert appeared by video.  Attorney Rockow appears for today only. Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Rockow relates time limits waived, preliminary examination requested.  Parties may appear by Zoom video to next hearing.  Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

***11:00 a.m. Defendant now appears late by Zoom video.  Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney.
